page.title: 01PARTINGTON
page.content: Patrington is situated 4 miles W. of the North Sea coast and 17 miles E. of Hull.It was mentioned in the Domesday book as{PATRICTONE}and from Saxon times to the Reformation belonged to the Archbishops of York.Today the village is slowly expanding as new housing is replacing some of the derelict parts.For example the site of the old workhouse is being developed as a private residential area.About 2 miles S. of the village lies the hamlet of Patrington Haven which as its name suggests aws once joined to the Humber.Here a Leisure Park has been opened to attract holidaymakers to the area.The village church of St. Patrick's,known locally as the Queen of Holderness dominates the area.
